abstract: Indoor tanning is considered serious public health concern due to higher rates of skin cancer, which have steadily risen since the 1990s, particularly among women under age 40; tanning is still very popular among teenage girls and both states and federal government have issued rules to curb practice; understanding of link between indoor tanning and cancer has been strengthened by research like federally funded Cancer Genome Atlas.
lead_paragraph: Tanning salons dot strip malls across the country, promising prettiness and, in some cases, better health, despite a growing body of evidence that links indoor tanning to skin cancer.
snippet: Tanning salons dot strip malls across the country, promising prettiness and, in some cases, better health, despite a growing body of evidence that links indoor tanning to skin cancer.

headline.main: Warning: That Tan Could Be Hazardous
headline.seo: Indoor Tanning Poses Cancer Risks, Teenagers Learn
headline.print_headline: Warning: That Tan Could Be Hazardous
